p: Firstly, climate is a critical factor in the spread of vector-borne diseases, especially if it is taken into account that it increases the risks and facilitates the expansion of MBD epidemics. The sustained changes being observed in the global and regional climates, as well as the non-climatic factors such as fragile health systems and insufficient surveillance systems, indicate that the Pacific region is exceptionally vulnerable to the (re-)emergence of MBDs.
